channel.title: Running Server/Client on a Mac
channel.description:
Hi. I have an Apple Macintosh OS X 10.4 at home and I rarely get to use a Windows. I'd like to be able to run a server at home on my Mac, so I can edit, compile and run, then transfer via memorystick when I come to my mums, but because it's all different like "bin/bash" etc. (and I've done trial and error for hours) I can't figure it out.
I've googled, searched on Mopar (but it just comes up with everyone else asking questions, and no answers) and my last resort is basically to beg someone to link me, please, to some sort of information on what I need to execute in Terminal and what I need to edit into the Compiler and Run.sh~ (If that's correct?).
It seems really hard to get information for Macs, and I know it's not the best thing for Private Servers but it's all I got.
Even if you was to PM me so it is private, would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Running Server/Client on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @Carter1 Carter`
item.description:
@Carter1 wrote:

So it’s that’s simple. :o Thanks for your help, Ry.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server/Client on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Just open Terminal and use java and javac. First use cd to change to the server directory, javac *.java to compile everything, and java server to run it.

macserver5.jpg766×630

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server/Client on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @Carter1 Carter`
item.description:
@Carter1 wrote:

Thanks. But the question is: can you help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server/Client on a Mac
item.dc:creator: @legend_the_hero legend the hero
item.description:
@legend_the_hero wrote:

the run.sh~ is meant to be run.bat. And tbh i’m not sure with the rest, you seem nice. so i would like to help you.

Read full topic
